assetIdentification.assetDescription: Provides route planning and guidance for vehicle navigation

damageScenarios.title: Navigation Misdirection
damageScenarios.description: Compromised navigation system provides incorrect directions that could lead the driver into dangerous areas, restricted zones, or inefficient routes

impactAreas.description: Driver could be directed into hazardous areas (e.g., wrong-way driving, non-vehicular paths, flood zones)
impactAreas.justification: Could potentially lead to accidents or vehicle damage in worst-case scenarios

impactAreas.description: Inefficient routing increases fuel consumption and vehicle wear
impactAreas.justification: Limited direct financial impact for individual drivers

impactAreas.description: Driver may become lost or delayed, requiring manual navigation correction
impactAreas.justification: Delays could be significant but most drivers would eventually recognize the issue

impactAreas.description: No direct privacy impact from incorrect navigation
impactAreas.justification: Misdirection itself doesn't compromise private data

impactAreas.description: Potential regulatory concerns if drivers are directed to restricted areas
impactAreas.justification: Could result in unintentional regulatory violations (restricted zones, protected areas)

impactAreas.description: Brand damage from unreliable navigation system
impactAreas.justification: Would affect customer satisfaction and potentially sales if widely reported

damageScenarios.justification: High safety concerns combined with moderate operational and reputational impacts
damageScenarios.asilJustification: Potential for physical harm via navigation misdirection warrants ASIL B classification

damageScenarios.title: Position Falsification
damageScenarios.description: Navigation system displays incorrect vehicle position, causing driver confusion and disorientation

impactAreas.description: Driver disorientation could contribute to unsafe driving behavior
impactAreas.justification: Most drivers would recognize discrepancy but could cause momentary distraction
Minimal cost impact beyond potential for slightly inefficient routing
Drivers would lose trust in system but could revert to other navigation methods
Position falsification doesn't inherently expose private data

impactAreas.description: Damage to product reputation for reliability
impactAreas.justification: Would affect customer satisfaction if occurring regularly

damageScenarios.justification: Medium safety impact combined with medium operational and reputational impacts
damageScenarios.asilJustification: Potential for distraction-related safety issues warrants ASIL A classification

damageScenarios.title: Navigation History Exposure
damageScenarios.description: User's navigation history, saved locations, and frequent destinations are exposed to unauthorized parties

impactAreas.description: Exposure of home location could create physical safety risk
impactAreas.justification: Could potentially enable physical targeting of vehicle owner

impactAreas.description: Costs associated with identity theft if combined with other personal information
impactAreas.justification: Limited direct financial impact but could contribute to broader identity theft

impactAreas.description: No significant operational impact to navigation function
Severe privacy violation revealing user movements and patterns
impactAreas.justification: Location history provides detailed insight into user's daily patterns and sensitive destinations

impactAreas.description: Violation of data protection regulations (GDPR, CCPA, etc.)
impactAreas.justification: Location data is protected by multiple privacy regulations globally

impactAreas.description: Significant brand damage from privacy breach
impactAreas.justification: Privacy breaches are highly publicized and damage consumer trust

damageScenarios.justification: High privacy, regulatory and reputational impacts combined with medium safety concerns
damageScenarios.asilJustification: Primary impact is privacy rather than direct safety, categorized as Quality Management

methodology.name: ISO21434 Asset Value Assessment
methodology.description: Assessment of asset value based on importance to vehicle functionality, safety, and security

valueFactors.justification: Navigation is an important convenience feature but not critical to basic vehicle operation
Can indirectly impact safety through driver distraction or misdirection, but does not directly control vehicle motion
Contains sensitive location history that reveals user patterns and behaviors
Connected to vehicle networks but with limited write access to critical systems
Receives external inputs (GPS, map updates) and potentially connects to phones and cloud services

assetValueAssessment.justification: High data sensitivity and external exposure combined with medium safety relevance and integration

cybersecurityGoals.title: Navigation Integrity
cybersecurityGoals.description: The system shall ensure the integrity of navigation data and routing instructions

cybersecurityGoals.title: Position Accuracy
cybersecurityGoals.description: The system shall maintain and verify the accuracy of displayed vehicle position

cybersecurityGoals.title: Navigation Privacy
cybersecurityGoals.description: The system shall protect the confidentiality of user location history and saved destinations

relatedRequirements.description: The navigation system shall provide accurate routing information
The navigation system shall display vehicle position with accuracy of +/- 5 meters
The navigation system shall encrypt all stored location data

keyTerms.Impact Analysis: Assessment of potential damage from security breaches
keyTerms.Damage Scenario: Description of potential harm from cybersecurity incidents

contentSummary: Impact analysis for the Navigation System identifying three key damage scenarios: Navigation Misdirection (Severe impact), Position Falsification (Moderate impact), and Navigation History Exposure (Severe impact). Each scenario is assessed across safety, financial, operational, privacy, regulatory, and reputational dimensions. The document establishes ASIL ratings and FMEA data for each scenario, and defines cybersecurity goals to address each damage scenario. The Navigation System is assessed as a high-value asset due to its data sensitivity and external exposure. This analysis serves as the foundation for threat scenario development and subsequent risk assessment in the TARA process.
